meanings.definition: To count again the total of something.
meanings.sent1: I will be retotalling the number of candies in the jar to make sure we have enough for everyone.
meanings.sent2: She retotalled the votes to confirm the winner of the election.
meanings.sent3: After retotalling the money in the piggy bank, I found an extra coin hidden at the bottom.
meanings.sent4: The detective retotalled the clues to solve the mystery of the missing necklace.
meanings.sent5: Retotalling the ingredients in the recipe is crucial for baking a delicious cake.

meanings.definition: The act of recounting the total of something.
meanings.sent1: The retotalling of the inventory revealed a discrepancy in the stock levels.
meanings.sent2: Her retotalling of the expenses showed where the budget had been overspent.
meanings.sent3: The retotalling of the votes at the end of the game caused a delay in announcing the winner.
meanings.sent4: The retotalling of the stars in the sky reminded her of the vastness of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The retotalling of the pages in the book helped her keep track of her progress.
